content:
I think I'll give Trello a try for organizing my tasks and ideas. I've heard great things about it, and I like the visual approach to task management. I'll set up boards, lists, and cards to break down my project proposal into smaller, manageable chunks. That way, I can easily track my progress and stay focused on the tasks at hand.

I'll also use Evernote to take notes and jot down ideas as they come to me. I like the idea of having a centralized hub for all my notes and ideas, and Evernote seems like a great tool for that.

As for staying focused, I think I'll try the Pomodoro Timer technique. I've heard it's a great way to boost productivity and avoid burnout. I'll set the timer for 25 minutes, work on my project proposal without any distractions during that time, and then take a short break before repeating the process.

Thanks for the suggestions! I feel more organized and focused already.
